activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Cole Baldwin

records.addlTxt:
11:26 AM Defendant Devin Cole Baldwin appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE qualifies for PD representation. State relates counsel has not yet been appointed for DE.  Court relates AIA cannot be held without counsel present and resets to 11/11/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with J.H.Z. 
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises.

1:05 PM Defendant Devin Cole Baldwin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito appeared by video for Devin Cole Baldwin for today only. Address confirmed and phone number provided/updated.   Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  State relates and requests cash bond.  Defendant does not object to cash bond.  1:09 p.m. Attorney Dippolito and Defendant put into a break-out room to discuss bond. 1:13 p.m. Back on the record and qualifies for public defender.  Attorney Dippolito relates.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
